page_analysis.text_content:
Detached 2nd-dwelling units & associated parking site planning
Fig 41 Examples of site planning solutions for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated required parking
A Detached & separate from main-
dwelling parking
• Main dwelling has a 1-car attached
garage.
• 2nd dwelling has a 1-car detached
garage. (Because it is detached and at
least 75' from the front lot line, it may be
located in the rear and side yards.)
• Both dwellings use driveway for their
uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)
Interior lot example
1-car
de-
tached
Rear yard
B Attached & separate from main-
dwelling parking
• Main dwelling has 1-car attached garage.
• 2nd dwelling has a 1-car attached
garage. (Because attached, it must be
located with the building area rather than
in the rear or side yards).
• Both dwellings use driveway for their
uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)
Interior lot example
Rear yard
C Detached & combined with
main-dwelling parking
• Both dwellings share a 2-car detached
garage. (Because it is detached and at
least 75' from the front lot line, it may be
located in the rear and side yards.)
• Both dwellings use the driveway for their
respective uncovered spaces (beyond
front setback)
2-car
detached
for both
dwellings
Interior lot example
Rear yard
D Combined w/ main-dwelling
parking that is attached to main
dwelling
• Both dwellings share a 2-car attached
garage.
• Both dwellings use the driveway for their
respective uncovered spaces (beyond
front setback)

visual_elements.description: Figure 41: Examples of site planning solutions for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated required parking. The figure consists of four distinct site plans (A, B, C, D) arranged horizontally, each illustrating a different parking and dwelling configuration on an 'Interior lot example'. Each plan shows a 'Main dwelling' and a 'Detached 2nd dwelling unit' (900 sf max), along with associated parking (1-car attached, 1-car detached, or 2-car detached/attached). Key elements like 'Front yard', 'Rear yard', 'Interior-side yard', 'Buildable area', 'Required setbacks', 'Curb', 'Lot line', and 'Sidewalk' are depicted. Cars are shown in parking spaces. The 'Buildable area' is light grey, 'Dwelling' is medium grey, '2nd-dwelling unit & associated pkg' is dark grey, and 'Uncovered space' is white with car icons. 'Area that may not be used to satisfy required parking spaces' is indicated by diagonal hatching.

Key for the diagram, defining symbols and colors used:
- Solid black line: Curb
- Dashed black line: Lot line
- Grey checkered pattern: Sidewalk
- Dashed black line (thicker): Required setbacks
- Light grey shaded area: Dwelling
- White area with diagonal hatching: Area that may not be used to satisfy required parking spaces
- Light grey shaded area with dashed outline: Buildable area
- Dark grey shaded area: 2nd-dwelling unit & associated pkg
- White area with car icon: Uncovered space

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum setback from main dwelling to 2nd dwelling unit (vertical separation)
Minimum setback for detached 2nd dwelling unit from front lot line (for rear/side yard placement)

structural_elements.main_heading: Detached 2nd-dwelling units & associated parking site planning
subheadings: A Detached & separate from main-dwelling parking
B Attached & separate from main-dwelling parking
C Detached & combined with main-dwelling parking
D Combined w/ main-dwelling parking that is attached to main dwelling
sections: Fig 41 Examples of site planning solutions for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated required parking

additional_notes: The text 'ming' appears twice in the OCR, likely a misinterpretation of 'min.' (minimum) or a graphical artifact near the 3' dimension line in the diagrams for A and C. Given the context of '12' min.', it is highly probable it refers to 'min.' for the 3' dimension as well.

The text '200 sf max' appears under 'Detached 2nd dwelling unit' in diagram B, but the main text and other diagrams consistently state '900 sf max'. This '200 sf max' is likely an OCR error or a specific, smaller, and potentially incorrect label within that diagram, as the '900 sf max' is more prominent and consistent.
The character 'į' at the end of the last bullet point for section C is likely an OCR error for a closing parenthesis ')'.

qualifiers.text: Because it is detached and at least 75' from the front lot line
Because it is detached and at least 75' from the front lot line

conditions.text: Main dwelling has a 1-car attached garage.
it may be located in the rear and side yards.
Both dwellings use driveway for their uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)
it must be located with the building area rather than in the rear or side yards).
Both dwellings use driveway for their uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)
Both dwellings share a 2-car detached garage.
it may be located in the rear and side yards.
Both dwellings use the driveway for their respective uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)
Both dwellings share a 2-car attached garage.
Both dwellings use the driveway for their respective uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)

logical_relationships.expression: IF (2nd dwelling has a 1-car detached garage AND (it is detached AND at least 75' from the front lot line)) THEN it may be located in the rear and side yards.
IF (2nd dwelling has a 1-car attached garage AND (Because attached)) THEN it must be located with the building area rather than in the rear or side yards.
IF (Both dwellings share a 2-car detached garage AND (it is detached AND at least 75' from the front lot line)) THEN it may be located in the rear and side yards.
